# HealthTrack Pro Sprint 1 Daily Scrum Meeting Report

## Brief Overview
The Sprint 1 Daily Scrum Meeting for HealthTrack Pro was held on June 11, 2024, focusing on the initial progress of the sprint that runs from June 10 to June 24. As the Project Manager and Scrum Master, your role in facilitating this meeting and following up on key points is crucial for the sprint's success.

## Key Meeting Highlights
- Development environments are in various stages of setup, with minor issues being addressed
- User registration implementation has begun, with a focus on security and HIPAA compliance
- Frontend development is prioritizing accessibility and resolving Tailwind CSS configuration issues
- DevOps progress includes setting up separate workflows for different environments
- Design updates are ongoing, with 60% of wireframe modifications completed
- Social login options have been removed from the initial design

## Sprint 1 Overview
![Diagram](https://mermaid.)

## Action Items and Next Steps for You
1. Schedule a HIPAA compliance discussion for tomorrow afternoon (June 12)
2. Follow up on the decision regarding the charting library (Chart.js vs D3.js) in the next technical meeting
3. Monitor the resolution of AWS permissions issues between Alex and Olivia
4. Ensure Alex and Michael sync about JWT implementation and HIPAA-compliant token storage
5. Facilitate the technical deep dive on authentication implementation led by Alex tomorrow (June 12)
6. Confirm that Liam provides updated wireframes by end of day today (June 11)
7. Continue to manage the sprint board and track progress on all tasks
8. Prepare for tomorrow's HIPAA compliance discussion, gathering any necessary resources or information

## General Team Information
- Development environment setup is progressing well, with most team members nearing completion
- HIPAA compliance and security measures are a top priority, affecting all aspects of development
- Frontend development is focusing on accessibility and custom Tailwind configurations
- DevOps has set up separate workflows for dev, staging, and prod environments in GitHub Actions
- Current blockers include Tailwind configuration issues, AWS permissions in the CI/CD pipeline, and finalizing HIPAA-compliant implementations
- The project backlog has been updated, with user registration and basic dashboard layout now in progress

## Conclusion
As the Scrum Master, your role in facilitating communication, addressing blockers, and ensuring adherence to Agile principles is crucial for the success of Sprint 1. Continue to monitor the team's progress closely, especially regarding HIPAA compliance and the resolution of current blockers. Your leadership in the upcoming meetings and discussions will be key to maintaining project momentum and addressing potential risks early in the development process.
